vulnerability_information: ## Summary The search functionality at `/search-partial` attempts to filter ` ``` This should not execute (script tags are removed) 3. Bypass the filter using an img tag: ``` /search-partial?q= ``` 4. The img tag is not filtered and the onerror event fires, executing JavaScript ## Proof of Concept ```http GET /search-partial?q= HTTP/1.1 Host: target.com ``` The response contains the unfiltered img tag which triggers the onerror handler. ## Impact - The XSS fix is bypassable using event handler attributes - Same impact as original reflected XSS (session hijacking, phishing) - The filter gives a false sense of security
